Node.definition: = referent pointing to a point in time, usually in reference to another event
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) in post exilic times
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
= action by which someone carefully focuses his/her eyes on a group of objects in order to locate something specific among them

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= room or place in which valuable items are kept, usually in a temple or palace
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= town; in Media
= a fortress that commands a city and is used in the control of the inhabitants and in defense during attack or siege.
= a nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by Madai; the empire was consolidated in the 6th 5th and stretched from Mesopotamia to Turkey
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city

= long strip of writing material made by sewing together sheets of papyrus or parchment; this strip was then rolled up from one end or from both ends to form one or two cylinders; usually the ends of the scroll were attached to sticks, around which the scroll was rolled; an unrolled scroll was often about 10 meters in length and stood approximately 23 25 centimeters high; the term מְגִלַּת־סֵפֶר seems to be the more complete term for a book scroll, as it occurs at the beginning of passages in which scrolls play a roll; the shorter term מְגִלָּה is used after that
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= a reference to a location in a written document
= a document with information that is to be remembered
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) who allowed the exiles from Judah (יְהוּדָה) to return
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) who allowed the exiles from Judah (יְהוּדָה) to return
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= a location associated with a certain object

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= large stone that was cut square ► so that it could be laid one on other stones to form a wall or building; ≈ associated with wealth and heaviness
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= a location associated with a certain object

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= man; ► governor of the province west of the Euphrates (פְּרָת) during the Persian empire
= region on the other side, situated across a stream, or the sea
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
= fellow member of the same group of people, sharing a bond of employment or a common purpose
= person of authority in the Persian empire
= region on the other side, situated across a stream, or the sea
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= a location associated with a certain object
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= objects in one's possession that are considered of value
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
exact meaning unsure; probably: = an amount of money that is to be paid to a ruler in return for certain rights or privileges
= region on the other side, situated across a stream, or the sea
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
= state in which an activity is carried out without unnecessary delay
= causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else
= a male human
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to cause (someone or some activity) to stop
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans no longer to be engaged in an action that they were engaged in previously

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= an object that is required
= large ruminant animal with horns and cloven hoofs, ► domesticated primarily for meat or milk, as a beast of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; a clean animal which can be eaten and sacrificed

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= young of a sheep, either male or female; ► clean animal, and allowed for food; also used for sacrifice
= action by which humans offer something to a deity by burning it in its entirety on the altar; considered to have a pleasing aroma
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= cereal plant bearing dense four sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin
= white crystalline substance, mainly consisting of sodium chloride; ► normally used for seasoning or preserving food; ≈ associated with infertility of the soil but also with permanence

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness

= high quality oil, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= words spoken by people in authority
= person ordained and consecrated to perform religious services on behalf of others
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= action by which humans call upon a deity, either to ask for something or to give thanks and praise

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; ≈ associated with mortality
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
literally: to be lifted up; hence: = process by which a human body is placed on a vertically position on a sharpened upright pole that will pierce it
literally: (one's body) is struck (on top of something); hence: = process by which a human body is placed on a vertically position on a sharpened upright pole that will pierce it

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= heap of dung, ashes, and other garbage, ◄ probably located outside of a population center; ≈ associated with poverty and low status
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to throw down; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to fail in their undertakings
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand > to lift a hand (to do something)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (to do something); hence: = action by which humans take a conscious decision to perform a certain event

Node.gloss: to destroy|to ruin|to devastate|to break|to harm
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone brings destruction and suffering upon humans and inanimate objects

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) in post exilic times
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
= state in which an activity is carried out without unnecessary delay
= referent pointing to a point in time, usually in reference to another event
= man; ► governor of the province west of the Euphrates (פְּרָת) during the Persian empire
= region on the other side, situated across a stream, or the sea
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
= fellow member of the same group of people, sharing a bond of employment or a common purpose
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) in post exilic times
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which an activity is carried out without unnecessary delay

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= action by which a person or an object is successful, completing a task or purpose according to the intended outcome
= action by which someone speaks or acts as a prophet (נָבִיא)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= man; ► prophet (נָבִיא) ◄ son of Berechiah, son of Iddo
aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► grandfather of Zechariah (זְכַרְיָה) prophet (נָבִיא)
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= causative process by which humans bring a building project to completion
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= an official statement that obliges people to behave according to its rules or directives
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) who allowed the exiles from Judah (יְהוּדָה) to return
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) in post exilic times
= man, better known as Artaxerxes I; ◄ son of Ahasuerus (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) (Xerxes I); ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) time of Ezra (עֶזְרָא) and Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a nation and its territory, which was greatly expanded during the reign of Cyrus (כֹּורֶשׁ) I.
= process by which a construction project comes to an end

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= one of twelve fractions of time that make up a year in the Israelite (lunar) calendar; ◄ equivalent to a full lunar cycle
= month, equivalent to period February/March; ► post exilic
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) in post exilic times
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= person ordained and consecrated to perform religious services on behalf of others
= member of the Levite clan, responsible for temple duties
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= action by which humans make a building or religious object ready for use ◄ usually by devoting it to a deity

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans feel happiness
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= action by which humans make a building or religious object ready for use ◄ usually by devoting it to a deity

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= large ruminant animal with horns and cloven hoofs, ► domesticated primarily for meat or milk, as a beast of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; a clean animal which can be eaten and sacrificed

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= young of a sheep, either male or female; ► clean animal, and allowed for food; also used for sacrifice
= state in which a countable entity is four in number

= male domestic animal, generally black in color, found in both shorthaired and longhaired varieties, with horns, usually herded together with sheep; ◄ Capra hircus mambrica or Capra hircus angorensis; ► clean animal, source of hides, hair, and horns, may be used for sacrifice; ≈ sometimes associated with demons, regarded as aggressive

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten
= action by which a human being performs the sacrificial ritual that is intended to remove the state of guilt from oneself or someone else

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= person ordained and consecrated to perform religious services on behalf of others
= a group of people within a larger group, placed together for a particular task or duty
= member of the Levite clan, responsible for temple duties
= a group of people within a larger group, placed together for a particular task or duty
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= a written document, written on an unspecified surface
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= process by which humans take the necessary steps to render themselves ceremonially pure
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= member of the Levite clan, responsible for temple duties
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which people, animals, or objects are considered free from contamination, ► as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the objects can be put to normal use
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

Node.gloss: to separate oneself|to defect|to sequester oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans disassociate themselves from a group of people

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy
= thin cracker like bread made without yeast
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to turn (someone's) heart; hence: = action by which deities cause humans to have a different opinion about other humans
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to be mentally strong able to deal with issues relating to their daily work and to morals and ethics
literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which human help other humans to find the courage to perform a certain event

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
